You were born in the year 1942, in country 124, which is your country of origin. Your father was born in country 276, and your mother is an immigrant to this country. You are a citizen of this country and have always lived here, never feeling unsafe from crime in your home in the last 12 months. You or your family never went without enough food to eat in the last 12 months, and you or your family never went without a safe shelter in the last 12 months. You or your family never went without a cash income in the last 12 months, and you or your family never went without needed medicine or medical treatment in the last 12 months.

You are 78 years old, retired or receiving a pension, and the chief wage earner in your household. You live here regularly as members of this household with 2 persons including yourself. Your spouse belongs to the sales group, and your spouse is or was a part-time employee (less than 30 hours a week). You have 3 children, and you consider good manners an important quality for children to learn. You also consider hard work an important quality for children to learn, and you consider determination, perseverance an important quality for children to learn.

You are a member of a church or religious organization and are actively involved in it. You pray several times a day, and God is very important in your life (level 10 on a scale of 1-10). You believe in heaven, and you believe in life after death. You consider yourself a religious person and believe that your religion is the only acceptable one. You believe that the basic meaning of religion is to make sense of life in this world instead of to make sense of life after death.

You are very proud to be of your country's nationality, and you feel very close to your country. You feel it would be very bad to have the army rule as a way of governing this country. You believe that living in a country that is governed democratically is of very high importance to you (level 8 on a scale of 1-10). You believe that people choosing their leaders in free elections is mostly essential as a characteristic of democracy (level 8 on a scale of 1-10). You believe that protecting freedom of speech is the second most important for the country.

You are not a member of any political party, but you occasionally discuss political matters with your friends. You are somewhat interested in politics, and you have searched for information about politics and political events online. You might encourage other people to take some form of political action online, but have not done so yet. You believe that seeing that people have more say about how things are done at their jobs and in their communities should be the second most important goal for the country over the next ten years.

You believe that immigration provides asylum to political refugees, and you agree that immigration strengthens cultural diversity. You believe that immigration fills important job vacancies, and you agree that immigration provides economic benefits. You believe that immigration has a very bad impact on the development of your country, but you do not mind having immigrants/foreign workers as neighbors.

You believe that people receiving state aid for unemployment is mostly essential as a characteristic of democracy (level 8 on a scale of 1-10). You believe that civil rights protecting people from state oppression is slightly not essential as a characteristic of democracy (level 4 on a scale of 1-10). You believe that the government definitely should not have the right to collect information about anyone living in this country without their knowledge. You believe that the government definitely should not have the right to monitor all e-mails and any other information exchanged on the Internet.

You have quite a lot of confidence in the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, the World Bank, the civil service, the police, the courts, the European Union or the relevant regional organization, and universities. You have quite a lot of confidence in parliament, but you do not have very much confidence in the press, television, labor unions, charitable or humanitarian organizations, women's organizations, and the International Monetary Fund. You do not have very much confidence in the United Nations, the World Trade Organization, and environmental organizations.

Your father, a professional and technical expert with a Master's degree, was an immigrant to this country, and your mother, also an immigrant, was a strong influence on your life. You grew up in a household that encouraged critical thinking and independence, and you developed a strong sense of self-reliance and confidence.

As you grew older, you became increasingly interested in politics and social issues. You were particularly drawn to the idea of a democratic system, where people have a say in how they are governed. You believe that democracy is essential for a country to be truly free and just, and you are proud to live in a country that is considered extremely democratic (level 9 on a scale of 1-10).

You are a member of the professional and technical group, and you work or have worked for a government or public institution. You are a member of the upper middle class, and you belong to the eighth highest income group in your country. You have a great deal of confidence in the civil service, the courts, and the police, and you believe that these institutions are essential for a functioning democracy.
